dublinCore.dc:title: 110 HR 2623 RH: To amend title 38, United States Code, to
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to prohibit the collection of copayments for all hospice care furnished by the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.header: Prohibition on collection of copayments for all hospice care furnished by Department of Veterans Affairs
section.text: Section 1710B(c)(2) of title 38, United States Code is amended by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph (B):

section.header: Prohibition on collection of copayments for all hospice care furnished by Department of Veterans Affairs
section.text: Title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 1710(g)(1), by inserting “(except if such services constitute hospice care) after medical services; and
in section 1710B(c)(2), by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph (B):

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
